titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I wrote letters all the morning: walked in the Park during the afternoon: & read Pastor's history of the Popes when I returned – there is the day's record. During the morning,

, the painter, called in order to "rectify his colouring" of my face, which he had painted from one of the photographs which he took in the large dining room some weeks ago. He painted while I proceeded with my letter–writing. The sketch he showed was recognizable, &, perhaps, clever, but not amiable or anywise attractive! But that was not the artist's fault. The League of Nations has adjourned until September, with its avowed purpose, the admission of Germany to a seat on the Council, unachieved, & with an immense, perhaps a fatal, loss of prestige.
